verses.verse: To the chief<WH5329> Musician,<WH5329> A Psalm<WH4210> of David.<WH1732> Deliver<WH2502> me, O LORD,<WH3068> from the evil<WH7451> man:<WH120> preserve<WH5341> me from the violent<WH2555> man;<WH376>
Which<WH834> imagine<WH2803> mischiefs<WH7451> in their heart;<WH3820> continually<WH3605> <WH3117> are they gathered<WH1481> together for war.<WH4421>
They have sharpened<WH8150> their tongues<WH3956> like a serpent;<WH5175> adders'<WH5919> poison<WH2534> is under<WH8478> their lips.<WH8193> Selah.<WH5542>

Keep<WH8104> me, O LORD,<WH3068> from the hands<WH3027> of the wicked;<WH7563> preserve<WH5341> me from the violent<WH2555> man;<WH376> who<WH834> have purposed<WH2803> to overthrow<WH1760> my goings.<WH6471>

The proud<WH1343> have hid<WH2934> a snare<WH6341> for me, and cords;<WH2256> they have spread<WH6566> a net<WH7568> by the wayside;<WH3027> <WH4570> they have set<WH7896> gins<WH4170> for me. Selah.<WH5542>
I said<WH559> to the LORD,<WH3068> You are my God:<WH410> hear<WH238> the voice of my supplications,<WH8469> O LORD.<WH3068>
O GOD<WH3069> the Lord,<WH136> the strength<WH5797> of my salvation,<WH3444> you have covered<WH5526> my head<WH7218> in the day<WH3117> of battle.<WH5402>
Grant<WH5414> not, O LORD,<WH3068> the desires<WH3970> of the wicked:<WH7563> further<WH6329> not his wicked<WH2162> device; lest they exalt<WH7311> themselves. Selah.<WH5542>
As for the head<WH7218> of those that compass<WH4524> me about, let the mischief<WH5999> of their own lips<WH8193> cover<WH3680> them.
Let burning<WH784> coals<WH1513> fall<WH4131> on them: let them be cast<WH5307> into the fire;<WH784> into deep<WH4113> pits, that they rise<WH6965> not up again.
Let not an evil speaker<WH376> <WH3956> be established<WH3559> in the earth:<WH776> evil<WH7451> shall hunt<WH6679> the violent<WH2555> man<WH376> to overthrow<WH4073> him.
I know<WH3045> that the LORD<WH3068> will maintain<WH6213> the cause<WH1779> of the afflicted,<WH6041> and the right<WH4941> of the poor.<WH34>
Surely<WH389> the righteous<WH6662> shall give thanks<WH3034> to your name:<WH8034> the upright<WH3477> shall dwell<WH3427> in your presence.<WH6440>
